page.title: 16Public Houses.
page.content: There are three public houses in Blackmore.At the head of Church Street lies the picturesque{Bull Inn}.This {inn}dates from 1500 and has ancient beams on display.Local history says that it might have been the brewing house for he Priory.Besides the{trade {in}alcoholic and soft drinks,snacks and meals are served inside and in the back garden.At certain times the inn has a folk club upstairs{.The Leather {Bottle}is situated on Horsefair Green. The present premises only date back to 1954 when the original Inn was destroyed by fire. Like the other pubs it serves snacks and meals.{The Prince {Albert},opposite the post office,was named after Queen Victoria's husband. It has a lot of beams and brasswork and a large collection of key rings pinned to overhead beams.
